titleStmt.title: Monotonicity properties of a function involving the psi function with applications

analytic.title: Monotonicity properties of a function involving the psi function with applications

div.p: In this paper, we present the best possible parameter a ∈ (1/15, ∞) such that the functions ψ (x + 1) -L x (x, a) and ψ (x + 1) -L xx (x, a) are strictly increasing or decreasing with respect to x ∈ (0, ∞), where L(x, a) = 1 90a 2 +2 log(x 2 + x + 3a+1 3 ) + 45a 2 90a 2 +2 log(x 2 + x + 15a-1 45a ) and ψ(x) is the classical psi function. As applications, we get several new sharp bounds for the psi function and its derivatives.

div.head: Introduction
div.p: For real and positive values of x, Euler's gamma function and its logarithmic derivative ψ, the so-called psi function, are defined by (x) = +∞  t x- e -t dt, ψ(x) = (x) (x) , respectively. For extensions of these functions to complex variables and for basic properties see []. Recently, the gamma function and psi function ψ have been the subject of intensive research. In particular, many remarkable inequalities and monotonicity properties for these functions can be found in the literature [-]. Recently, Yang [] introduced the function
and proved that the double inequality

holds for all x >  if and only if a ≤ a  = . . . . and b ≥ ( +  √ )/ = . . . . if a ∈ (/, ∞) and b ∈ (/, ∞), where a  is the unique solution of the equation L(, a) = ψ().

div.head: Partial derivative computations give
div.p: by use of the L'Hôspital's rule and the formula

The main purpose of this paper is to present the best possible parameter a ∈ (/, ∞) such that the functions ψ (x + ) -L x (x, a) and ψ (x + ) -L xx (x, a) are strictly increasing or decreasing with respect to x ∈ (, ∞), and establish several new sharp bounds for the psi function and its derivatives. All numerical computations are carried out using the MATHEMATICA software.

div.head: Lemmas
div.p: In order to prove our main results we need several lemmas, which we present in this section.

div.head: Lemma . (see []
div.p: ) Let L(x, a) be defined on (, ∞) × (/, ∞) by (.). Then the following statements are true:
(i) the functions a → ∂L(x, a)/∂x is strictly decreasing, a → ∂  L(x, a)/∂x  is strictly increasing and a → ∂  L(x, a)/∂x  is strictly decreasing on (/, ∞);
div.formula: (ii) the function a → L xx (x, a) -L xx (y, a) is strictly decreasing on (/, ∞) if x > y > ; (iii) the inequalities ψ (x + ) -L x [x, ( +  √ )/] > , ψ (x + ) -L xx [x, ( +  √ )/] < , and ψ (x + ) -L xxx [x, ( +  √ )/] >  hold for all x > .

div.head: Lemma . (see [])
div.p: The identity
div.formula: ψ n (x + ) -ψ n (x) = (-) n n! x n+
div.p: holds for all x >  and n ∈ N.

div.head: Lemma . (see []
div.p: ) Let λ ∈ R and f be a real-valued function defined on the interval
div.formula: I = (λ, ∞) with lim x→∞ f (x) = . Then f (x) <  if f (x + ) -f (x) >  for all x ∈ I, and f (x) >  if f (x + ) -f (x) <  for all x ∈ I.

div.head: Main results
div.p: Theorem . Let L(x, a) be defined on (, ∞) × (/, ∞) by (.) and F a (x) = ψ(x + ) -L(x, a). Then the following statements are true:
div.formula: (i) F a (x) is strictly increasing with respect to x on (, ∞) if and only if a ≥ a  = ( +  √ )/ = . . . . ; (ii) F a (x) is strictly decreasing with respect to x on (, ∞) if and only if a ≤ a  = ( -π  +  √ π  -π  + )/[(π  -)] = . . . . . Proof (i) If F a (x) is strictly increasing with respect to x on (, ∞), then lim x→∞ [x  F a (x)] ≥ .
div.p: Making use of L'Hôspital's rule and (.) we get
Therefore, F a (x) is strictly increasing with respect to x on (, ∞).
(ii) If F a (x) is strictly decreasing with respect to x on (, ∞), then

div.head: Corollary .
div.p: (i) The double inequalities
div.formula: L x (x, a  ) < ψ (x + ) < L x (x, a  )
div.p: and
div.formula: L xx (x, a  ) < ψ (x + ) < L xx (x, a  )
div.p: hold for all x >  with the best possible constants a  , a  , and a  . (ii) The double inequalities
hold for all x > .

div.head: Acknowledgements
div.p: The authors wish to thank the anonymous referees for their careful reading of the manuscript and their fruitful comments and suggestions. The research was supported by the Natural Science Foundation of China under Grants 11301127, 61374086 and 11171307, and the Natural Science Foundation of Zhejiang Province under Grant LY13A010004. div.head: Competing interests
div.p: The authors declare that they have no competing interests.

div.head: Authors' contributions
div.p: All authors contributed equally to the writing of this paper. All authors read and approved the final manuscript.
